alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 14 at 2:50AM MDT until June 15 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .An upper level trough approaching from the west will spread strong west to southwest winds over much of the region Thursday. The combination of rising temperatures, very low humidity, strong winds, and an unstable airmass will elevate the risk for critical fire weather conditions. Any fires that develop over the next few days will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...East Central Plains (Zone 126) from Thursday afternoon into the early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
